Question: why are the gtiffs when displayed in qgis greyscale?

```{r }
library (raster)
setwd("C:/users/Keltoskytoi/Desktop/WS2016_2017/msc-phygeo-class-of-2016-keltoskytoi/remote_sensing/")
R1<-raster("478000_5630000.tif")
R2<-raster("478000_5632000.tif")
R3<-raster ("geonode_las_intensity_05.tif")
print(R3)

crop1<-crop(R1, extent (474000, 479000, 5630000, 5634000))
plot(crop1)

crop2<-crop(R2, extent (474000, 479000, 5630000, 5634000))            
plot(crop2)

writeRaster (crop1,"C:/users/Keltoskytoi/Desktop/WS2016_2017/msc-phygeo-class-of-2016-keltoskytoi/remote_sensing/cropped1,tif", "GTiff") 
writeRaster (crop2,"C:/users/Keltoskytoi/Desktop/WS2016_2017/msc-phygeo-class-of-2016-keltoskytoi/remote_sensing/cropped2,tif" ,"GTiff")
```
